meanings.definition: Causing a sharp pain or smarting sensation
meanings.sent1: The bee's stinging attack left a painful mark on my arm.
meanings.sent2: The stinging sensation from the ant bite quickly faded away.
meanings.sent3: The stinging comment made by the teacher caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent4: Her stinging words pierced through his heart like sharp arrows.
meanings.sent5: The stinging cold wind made me shiver uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: Sharp or biting in manner or style
meanings.sent1: His stinging criticism of her work was unnecessary.
meanings.sent2: The author's stinging wit added humor to the story.
meanings.sent3: She gave him a stinging reply that made him rethink his words.
meanings.sent4: The stinging sarcasm in her tone was hard to miss.
meanings.sent5: His stinging retort shut down the argument instantly.

meanings.definition: A sharp pain or smarting sensation
meanings.sent1: The sudden stinging in his eyes made him tear up.
meanings.sent2: She winced at the stinging in her knee after the fall.
meanings.sent3: The stinging from the cut was a reminder to be more careful.
meanings.sent4: The stinging of the sunburn was unbearable during the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The stinging of the injection was over quickly, leaving a small mark.
